p: These data are in line with clinical data showing elevated levels of IL-6 in sputum of asthmatic children during virus-induced exacerbation [ 34] and IL-4 triggered airway responsiveness in asthmatic patients [ 35]. Additionally, a study of Massoud and colleagues showed that IL-4 and IL-6 are involved in converting induced regulatory T (T reg) cells into T H-17 like cells, therefore potentially contributing to asthma severity [ 36]. Thus, reduced levels of IL-4 and IL-6 by rupintrivir could abolish the ongoing inflammation triggered by T H-2 cytokines IL-4 and IL-6 in asthmatic patients.
